intro: Lampranthus swartbergensis, commonly known as the Swartberg ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to gardens.
